title: TP-Link Smart Bulb Vulnerabilities Expose Households to Hacker Attacks
description:
Vulnerabilities in the TP-Link Tapo L530E smart bulb and accompanying mobile application can be exploited to obtain the local Wi-Fi password.

The post TP-Link Smart Bulb Vulnerabilities Expose Households to Hacker Attacks appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Hacker Conversations: Cris Thomas (AKA Space Rogue) From Lopht Heavy Industries
description:
Cris Thomas, also known as Space Rogue, was a founding member of the Lopht Heavy Industries hacker collective.

The post Hacker Conversations: Cris Thomas (AKA Space Rogue) From Lopht Heavy Industries appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: US Military Targeted in Recent HiatusRAT Attack
description:
The threat actor behind HiatusRAT was seen performing reconnaissance against a US military procurement system in June 2023.

The post US Military Targeted in Recent HiatusRAT Attack appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Ransomware Group Starts Leaking Data From Japanese Watchmaking Giant Seiko
description:
The BlackCat/ALPHV ransomware group has started publishing data allegedly stolen from Japanese watchmaking giant Seiko.

The post Ransomware Group Starts Leaking Data From Japanese Watchmaking Giant Seiko appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Australian Energy Software Firm Energy One Hit by Cyberattack
description:
Energy One, an Australian company that provides software products and services to the energy sector, has been hit by a cyberattack.

The post Australian Energy Software Firm Energy One Hit by Cyberattack appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: New ‘Carderbee’ APT Targeted Chinese Security Software in Supply Chain Attack
description:
A new APT group called Carderbee has been observed deploying the PlugX backdoor via a supply chain attack targeting organizations in Hong Kong.

The post New ‘Carderbee’ APT Targeted Chinese Security Software in Supply Chain Attack appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Grip Security Lands $41 Million Series B Financing
description:
Israeli startup Grip Security has banked $41 million in new financing from a group of investors led by Third Point Ventures.

The post Grip Security Lands $41 Million Series B Financing appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Cerby Raises $17 Million for Access Management Platform for Nonstandard Applications
description:
Cerby has raised $17 million in Series A funding for its access management platform for applications not supported by identity providers.

The post Cerby Raises $17 Million for Access Management Platform for Nonstandard Applications appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: CISA Warns of Another Exploited Adobe ColdFusion Vulnerability
description:
CISA warns that CVE-2023-26359, an Adobe ColdFusion vulnerability patched in March, has been exploited in the wild.

The post CISA Warns of Another Exploited Adobe ColdFusion Vulnerability appeared first on SecurityWeek.
